intro: Hieracium antholzense, commonly known as the Alpine hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy habitats at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are basal, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disc. Hieracium antholzense is often found in mountainous areas of the Alps and is adapted to the harsh environmental conditions of its habitat.
